children.text:
Welcome! 

We, NAVER, are providing this terms of use (“Terms of Use”) on this screen, so you can easily check its terms. We will continue to work hard to provide PHOLAR Service in consistent and continuous manner, and we hope you can better understand PHOLAR Service by this Terms of Use.



Please see below for definition of terms used in this Terms of Use. 

“Content” means any data, text, files, information, usernames, images, graphics, photos, profiles, audio and video clips, sounds, musical works, works of authorship, applications, links and other content or materials that you submit, post or display on or via Service.

“Service” (or “PHOLAR Service”) is an interest based social network service made available by NAVER in which users who otherwise do not know each other post and share photos and videos with comments.

“User” is a person who agrees to be bound by the Terms of Use. 



We post the Terms of Use, so the User can easily access it; we may modify it from time to time.

We post Terms of Use within Service, so Users can easily access it, and we may amend it as provided by applicable law. In the event of amendment, we may notify User about the amendment within the Service by posting its date and reason; we may also use electronic means to notify User for material amendment. 



Terms of Use and User Policy, based on their order of priority, complement each other. 

Matters not specified in this Terms of User may be set forth in separate User Policy, respective laws and regulations, or applicable commercial practice. 



There is a process required to use the Service. 

A binding agreement is formed when an applicant who intends to become a User(“Applicant”) agrees to the terms of the Terms of Use, submits an application to become User, and NAVER accepts this application. Applicant may open User account for PHOLAR by using his/her NAVER ID or other service account. NAVER will accept the application absent existence of unusual circumstance. User can start using the Service freely once NAVER accepts the application. 



We strive to protect User’s Personally Identifiable Information (“PPI”) 

NAVER only shall use the User’s PPI in accordance with respective laws to provide the Service. Please read our Privacy Policy [link] for more details. 



We strive to provide proper notice. 

When NAVER sends notice to User, unless otherwise provided, it will be made within Service or be made in other manner that NAVER deems appropriate. For notice that applies to all Users, it shall constitute a valid notice if NAVER posts the notice on the first page of PHOLAR Service or notice board for seven(7) days or longer. 



We listen to our Users. 

We strive to provide continuous and reliable service while complying with all applicable laws and regulations. We also maintain proper security system for User to use the Service in a secure manner, and we also post and comply with our Privacy Policy [link].  If we receive a legitimate comment or complaint from a User regarding the Service, we strive to reflect it. When necessary, we may use the notice board or use other means that we deem appropriate to inform User about how his/her complaint or comment is being handled. 



There are few cautions when using the Service. 

We retain all intellectual property rights relating to Service, except User’s intellectual property rights on Content. User shall not amend, change, or restrict any posting or other similar material provided by us relating to the Service. User shall not change any information we provided within the Service, or use the Service for profit without our consent. User shall also not falsely represent himself, violate intellectual property right, engage in defamatory act, or tortuously interfere with any third party’s business.  

You represent and warrant that: (i) you own the Content posted by you on or through the Service or otherwise have the right to grant the rights and licenses set forth in this Terms of Use; (ii) the posting and use of your Content on or through the Service does not violate, misappropriate or infringe on the rights of any third party, including, without limitation, privacy rights, publicity rights, copyrights, trademark and/or other intellectual property rights; (iii) you agree to pay for all royalties, fees, and any other monies owed by reason of Content you post on or through the Service; and (iv) you have the legal right and capacity to enter into these Terms of Use in your jurisdiction. You further represent and warrant that: (i) you will comply with the terms of this Terms of Use, User Policy, any guidance, caution, or notice given in relation to Service by us, as well as all applicable laws and regulations relating to Service; and (ii) you will not engage in any activity that may interfere with our course of business .   



We strive to provide reliable Service.

We may alter the Service in part or whole when there is an operational or technological need and a legitimate reason to do so. When there is a change in the Service’s content, using method, or operating hours, then we will post the cause, content, and date of this change, as well as other applicable details, on notice board within the Service or other method by which the User can recognize this fact, prior to the change. Unless otherwise provided in applicable law, we will not compensate User because of any change or cessation of Service, which is being provided free of charge. 



We can provide diverse information. 

We can provide a variety of information that User may need while using the Service via, notice within the Service, push alarm, or through other means, and User may choose not to receive them at any time except when it is information legally required to be provided to User or an answer to an inquiry by a User. However, in accordance with applicable law, if we plan to provide information that is advertisement for profit in nature via electronic means, we will receive a separate User consent prior to sending such information.   



We ask you to work together to protect copyright. 

User may upload Content or write comment via his/her account. Contents uploaded on his/her account may be searched, collected, linked in other sites. If User is the copyright holder of the uploaded Content, (s)he retains all rights relating to the Content and (s)he is responsible for the rights. If a person other than the User is the copyright holder, User shall obtain the right to upload it prior to uploading, and the User shall also specify its source. In this event, the original copyright holder retains all rights relating to the Content. You hereby grant to NAVER a non-exclusive, fully paid and royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to use the Content that you post on or through the Service.



We provide process to protect the copyright holder. 

The copyright holder of Content retains all rights and obligations uploaded in the Service. It is possible to use the NAVER’s take down process to temporarily take down certain content, if a copyrighted material is being used without proper authorization; the content is defamatory; or it violates the portrait right or privacy. User whose Content has been taken down may protest and explain that takedown is not applicable and request for reloading the Content. Please refer to User Policy for more details. NAVER may restrict the User from using the Service if (s)he violates obligation under this Terms of Use or interferes with the normal operation of the Service. In case of permanent restriction from using the Service, any and all privileges the former User acquired via Service will expire without compensation. Please refer to User Policy for more detail. 

When we put User on restriction temporarily or permanently, we shall notify User, and User may state his/her objection according to policy set forth by NAVER. If such objection is valid, we shall promptly allow the User to use the Service.  



We reserve the right to take any and all legal actions against illegal or unauthorized use of the Service. 

We reserve the right to take down or delete Content without prior notice, if the Content infringes on the right of third party, e.g., intellectual property right, violates law, or violates Terms of Use or User Policy. We also may send warning notice, hide certain Content, or temporarily or permanently restrict User from using the Service for reasons such as violation of Terms of Use, inappropriate Content uploading, interference with rights of a third party, or interference with the Service.  Please refer to User Policy for more details. 



Service contains content owned or licensed by NAVER (NAVER Content). NAVER Content is protected by copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret and other laws, and, as between you and NAVER, NAVER owns and retains all rights in the NAVER Content and the Service. You will not remove, alter or conceal any copyright, trademark, service mark or other proprietary rights notices incorporated in or accompanying the NAVER Content and you will not reproduce, modify, adapt, prepare derivative works based on, perform, display, publish, distribute, transmit, broadcast, sell, license or otherwise exploit the NAVER Content. The NAVER name and logo are trademarks of NAVER, and may not be copied, imitated or used, in whole or in part, without the prior written permission of NAVER. In addition, all page headers, custom graphics, button icons and scripts are service marks, trademarks and/or trade dress of NAVER, and may not be copied, imitated or used, in whole or in part, without prior written permission from NAVER. 



We are only granting User the right to use Service in accordance with the terms set forth by NAVER, and User may not assign, sell, provide as security, or otherwise dispose this right. 



User does not own Service or retain copyright to Service by this Terms of Use but is only being allowed to use the Service, and User may only use the Service for his personal use. Except as otherwise stated explicitly, User may not copy or distribute NAVER Content, such as text, script, graphic send-function among Users, which are created by NAVER, and User shall not use, copy, or distribute other Users’ information obtained through Service for commercial purpose. 



You may leave Service any time. 

User may send request to terminate Terms of Use at any time, and we shall promptly honor this request in accordance with relevant laws. When User terminates this Terms of Use, except as otherwise provided in relevant laws and regulations, all of User’s data is deleted immediately, and it may not be possible to restore them. NAVER encourages you to maintain your own backup of your Content. In other words, NAVER is not a backup service and you agree that you will not rely on the Service for the purposes of Content backup or storage. NAVER will not be liable to you for any modification, suspension, or discontinuation of the Services, or the loss of any Content. You also acknowledge that the Internet may be subject to breaches of security and that the submission of Content or other information may not be secure.



When you terminate this Terms of Use, some Contents, such as profile picture or other Content associated with your account, are deleted. However, other Contents, such as your comment on notice board, are not deleted, so please delete them first before termination. 



Few exceptions apply regarding our obligation when operating the Service.

We shall be exempt from our obligation to provide Service in the event of force majeure, such as natural disaster. We also shall not be held responsible for Service interruption, when the User is responsible for such interruption, such as by losing his device and unable to access the Service, or when Service is inaccessible because of telecommunication technological failure, such as inability to access communication signal.   

We also shall not be held responsible for accuracy of Content posted by User, or any exchange made between Users or between User and a third party using the Service.  

Further, for this Service being provided free of charge, unless otherwise set forth in applicable law, we shall not be held responsible. We also shall not be responsible for any and all loss caused by User’s intentional or negligent failure to comply with the Terms of Use. We hereby inform you that our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy do not apply in the event the websites linked within the Service collect personally identifiable information. 



We also ask you to comply with following terms. 

You must be at least 14 years old to use the Service.



You are responsible for any activity that occurs through your account and you agree you will not sell, transfer, license or assign your account, followers, username, or any account rights. With the exception of people or businesses that are expressly authorized to create accounts on behalf of their employers or clients, NAVER prohibits the creation of and you agree that you will not create an account for anyone other than yourself. You also represent that all information you provide or provided to NAVER upon registration and at all other times will be true, accurate, current and complete and you agree to update your information as necessary to maintain its truth and accuracy.



You agree that you will not solicit, collect or use the login credentials of other NAVER users.



You are responsible for keeping your password secret and secure.



You must not defame, stalk, bully, abuse, harass, threaten, impersonate or intimidate people or entities and you must not post private or confidential information via the Service, including, without limitation, your or any other person's credit card information, social security or alternate national identity numbers, non-public phone numbers or non-public email addresses.



You may not use the Service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose. You agree to comply with all laws, rules and regulations applicable to your use of the Service and your Content, including but not limited to, copyright laws.



You are solely responsible for your conduct and Content that you submit, post or display on or via the Service.



You must not change, modify, adapt or alter the Service or change, modify or alter another website so as to falsely imply that it is associated with the Service or NAVER.



You must not create or submit unwanted email, comments, likes or other forms of commercial or harassing communications (a/k/a spam) to any NAVER users.



You must not use domain names or web URLs in your username without prior written consent from NAVER.



You must not interfere or disrupt the Service or servers or networks connected to the Service, including by transmitting any worms, viruses, spyware, malware or any other code of a destructive or disruptive nature. You may not inject content or code or otherwise alter or interfere with the way any NAVER page is rendered or displayed in a user's browser or device.



You must not create accounts with the Service through unauthorized means, including but not limited to, by using an automated device, script, bot, spider, crawler or scraper.



You must not attempt to restrict another User from using or enjoying the Service and you must not encourage or facilitate violations of these Terms of Use.



You agree that NAVER is not responsible for, and does not endorse, Content posted within the Service. NAVER does not have any obligation to prescreen, monitor, edit, or remove any Content.



You acknowledge and agree that your relationship with NAVER is not a confidential, fiduciary, or other type of special relationship, and that your decision to submit any Content does not place NAVER in a position that is any different from the position held by members of the general public, including with regard to your Content. None of your Content will be subject to any obligation of confidence on the part of NAVER, and NAVER will not be liable for any use or disclosure of any Content you provide



Disclaimer of Warranties

THE SERVICE, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, NAVER CONTENT, IS PROVIDED ON AN AS IS, AS AVAILABLE AND WITH ALL FAULTS BASIS. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMISSIBLE BY LAW, NEITHER NAVER NOR ITS PARENT COMPANY NOR ANY OF THEIR EMPLOYEES, MANAGERS, OFFICERS OR AGENTS (COLLECTIVELY, THE NAVER PARTIES) MAKE ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OR ENDORSEMENTS OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AS TO: (A) THE SERVICE; (B) THE NAVER CONTENT; (C) USER CONTENT; OR (D) SECURITY ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRANSMISSION OF INFORMATION TO NAVER OR VIA THE SERVICE. IN ADDITION, THE NAVER PARTIES HEREBY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, TITLE, CUSTOM, TRADE, QUIET ENJOYMENT, SYSTEM INTEGRATION AND FREEDOM FROM COMPUTER VIRUS.

THE NAVER PARTIES DO NOT REPRESENT OR WARRANT THAT THE SERVICE WILL BE ERROR-FREE OR UNINTERRUPTED; THAT DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED; OR THAT THE SERVICE OR THE SERVER THAT MAKES THE SERVICE AVAILABLE IS FREE FROM ANY HARMFUL COMPONENTS, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, VIRUSES. THE NAVER PARTIES DO NOT MAKE ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES THAT THE INFORMATION (INCLUDING ANY INSTRUCTIONS) ON THE SERVICE IS ACCURATE, COMPLETE, OR USEFUL. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK. THE NAVER PARTIES DO NOT WARRANT THAT YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE IS LAWFUL IN ANY PARTICULAR JURISDICTION, AND THE NAVER PARTIES SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIM SUCH WARRANTIES. SOME JURISDICTIONS LIMIT OR DO NOT ALLOW THE DISCLAIMER OF IMPLIED OR OTHER WARRANTIES SO THE ABOVE DISCLAIMER MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU TO THE EXTENT SUCH JURISDICTION'S LAW IS APPLICABLE TO YOU AND THESE TERMS OF USE.

BY ACCESSING OR USING THE SERVICE YOU REPRESENT AND WARRANT THAT YOUR ACTIVITIES ARE LAWFUL IN EVERY JURISDICTION WHERE YOU ACCESS OR USE THE SERVICE.

THE NAVER PARTIES DO NOT ENDORSE CONTENT AND SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIM ANY RESPONSIBILITY OR LIABILITY TO ANY PERSON OR ENTITY FOR ANY LOSS, DAMAGE (WHETHER ACTUAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE OR OTHERWISE), INJURY, CLAIM, LIABILITY OR OTHER CAUSE OF ANY KIND OR CHARACTER BASED UPON OR RESULTING FROM ANY CONTENT.

Limitation of Liability; Waiver

UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES WILL THE NAVER PARTIES BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, ECONOMIC, EXEMPLARY, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL LOSSES OR DAMAGES) THAT ARE DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY RELATED TO: (A) THE SERVICE; (B) THE NAVER CONTENT; (C) USER CONTENT; (D) YOUR USE OF, INABILITY TO USE, OR THE PERFORMANCE OF THE SERVICE; (E) ANY ACTION TAKEN IN CONNECTION WITH AN INVESTIGATION BY THE NAVER PARTIES OR LAW ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES REGARDING YOUR OR ANY OTHER PARTY'S USE OF THE SERVICE; (F) ANY ACTION TAKEN IN CONNECTION WITH COPYRIGHT OR OTHER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY OWNERS; (G) ANY ERRORS OR OMISSIONS IN THE SERVICE'S OPERATION; OR (H) ANY DAMAGE TO ANY USER'S COMPUTER, MOBILE DEVICE, OR OTHER EQUIPMENT OR TECHNOLOGY INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGE FROM ANY SECURITY BREACH OR FROM ANY VIRUS, BUGS, TAMPERING, FRAUD, ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, DEFECT, DELAY IN OPERATION OR TRANSMISSION, COMPUTER LINE OR NETWORK FAILURE OR ANY OTHER TECHNICAL OR OTHER MALFUNCTION, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGES FOR LOST PROFITS, LOSS OF GOODWILL, LOSS OF DATA, WORK STOPPAGE, ACCURACY OF RESULTS, OR COMPUTER FAILURE OR MALFUNCTION, EVEN IF FORESEEABLE OR EVEN IF THE NAVER PARTIES HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF OR SHOULD HAVE KNOWN OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY OR TORT (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, WHETHER CAUSED IN WHOLE OR IN PART BY NEGLIGENCE, ACTS OF GOD, TELECOMMUNICATIONS FAILURE, OR THEFT OR DESTRUCTION OF THE SERVICE). IN NO EVENT WILL THE NAVER PARTIES BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANYONE ELSE FOR LOSS, DAMAGE OR INJURY, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DEATH OR PERSONAL INJURY. IN NO EVENT WILL THE NAVER PARTIES TOTAL LIABILITY TO YOU FOR ALL DAMAGES, LOSSES OR CAUSES OR ACTION EXCEED ONE HUNDRED UNITED STATES DOLLARS ($100.00).

YOU AGREE THAT IN THE EVENT YOU INCUR ANY DAMAGES, LOSSES OR INJURIES THAT ARISE OUT OF NAVER'S ACTS OR OMISSIONS, THE DAMAGES, IF ANY, CAUSED TO YOU ARE NOT IRREPARABLE OR SUFFICIENT TO ENTITLE YOU TO AN INJUNCTION PREVENTING ANY EXPLOITATION OF ANY WEB SITE, SERVICE, PROPERTY, PRODUCT OR OTHER CONTENT OWNED OR CONTROLLED BY THE NAVER PARTIES, AND YOU WILL HAVE NO RIGHTS TO ENJOIN OR RESTRAIN THE DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION, DISTRIBUTION, ADVERTISING, EXHIBITION OR EXPLOITATION OF ANY WEB SITE, PROPERTY, PRODUCT, SERVICE, OR OTHER CONTENT OWNED OR CONTROLLED BY THE NAVER PARTIES.

BY ACCESSING THE SERVICE, YOU UNDERSTAND THAT YOU MAY BE WAIVING RIGHTS WITH RESPECT TO CLAIMS THAT ARE AT THIS TIME UNKNOWN OR UNSUSPECTED, AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUCH WAIVER, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU UNDERSTAND AND HEREBY EXPRESSLY WAIVE YOUR RIGHTS UNDER ANY LAW OF ANY JURISDICTION WHICH MAY PROVIDE FOLLOWING PHRASE OR HAVE SIMILAR EFFECT: A GENERAL RELEASE DOES NOT EXTEND TO CLAIMS WHICH THE CREDITOR DOES NOT KNOW OR SUSPECT TO EXIST IN HIS FAVOR AT THE TIME OF EXECUTING THE RELEASE, WHICH IF KNOWN BY HIM MUST HAVE MATERIALLY AFFECTED HIS SETTLEMENT WITH THE DEBTOR.

NAVER IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACTIONS, CONTENT, INFORMATION, OR DATA OF THIRD PARTIES, AND YOU RELEASE US, OUR DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AND AGENTS FROM ANY CLAIMS AND DAMAGES, KNOWN AND UNKNOWN, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH ANY CLAIM YOU HAVE AGAINST ANY SUCH THIRD PARTIES.

Indemnification

You (and also any third party for whom you operate an account or activity on the Service) agree to defend (at NAVER's request), indemnify and hold the NAVER Parties harmless from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including without limitation, reasonable attorney's fees and costs, arising out of or in any way connected with any of the following (including as a result of your direct activities on the Service or those conducted on your behalf): (i) your Content or your access to or use of the Service; (ii) your breach or alleged breach of these Terms of Use; (iii) your violation of any third-party right, including without limitation, any intellectual property right, publicity, confidentiality, property or privacy right; (iv) your violation of any laws, rules, regulations, codes, statutes, ordinances or orders of any governmental and quasi-governmental authorities, including, without limitation, all regulatory, administrative and legislative authorities; or (v) any misrepresentation made by you. You will cooperate as fully required by NAVER in the defense of any claim. NAVER reserves the right to assume the exclusive defense and control of any matter subject to indemnification by you, and you will not in any event settle any claim without the prior written consent of NAVER.



Entire Agreement 

If any provision of these Terms of Use is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or otherwise unenforceable, the parties nevertheless agree that such portion will be deemed severable from these Terms of Use and will not affect the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions, and the remaining provisions of the Terms of Use remain in full force and effect. Neither the course of conduct between the parties nor trade practice will act to modify the Terms of Use. These Terms of Use do not confer any third-party beneficiary rights.



Miscellaneous

If you are using the Service on behalf of a legal entity, you represent that you are authorized to enter into an agreement on behalf of that legal entity. These Terms of Use constitute the entire agreement between you and NAVER and governs your use of the Service, superseding any prior agreements between you and NAVER. You will not assign the Terms of Use or assign any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of NAVER. Any purported assignment or delegation by you without the appropriate prior written consent of NAVER will be null and void.



Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

The laws of the Republic of Korea, without regard to principles of conflict of laws, will govern this Agreement and any dispute of any sort that might arise between you and NAVER. You agree that any cause of action that may arise under this Agreement shall be commenced and be heard in the appropriate court in the Republic of Korea. You agree to submit to the personal and exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located within the Republic of Korea.

Territorial Restrictions

The information provided within the Service is not intended for distribution to or use by any person or entity in any jurisdiction or country where such distribution or use would be contrary to law or regulation or which would subject NAVER to any registration requirement within such jurisdiction or country. We reserve the right to limit the availability of the Service or any portion of the Service, to any person, geographic area, or jurisdiction, at any time and in our sole discretion, and to limit the quantities of any content, program, product, service or other feature that NAVER provides.

Pursuant to ACT ON PROMOTION OF INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS NETWORK UTILIZATION AND INFORMATION PROTECTION, ETC, for user wishing to become a member of PHOLAR, we provide the list of personal information being collected, purpose of collecting and using personal information, period for saving and using personal information. Please read them carefully and provide your consent if you agree with the terms. The User may disagree with collection and use of personal information, but then becoming a member of PHOLAR may be impossible. PHOLAR only collects minimum amount of personal information necessary to provide service.

1. List of Personal Information Collected and Collection Method
-	The Company provides various social login methods to allow users to conveniently become a member and use the service, and the Company processes member’s privacy information as follows. The type and method of social login used to join membership may differ from country to country. When using e-mail address to become a member: e-mail address, password, and nickname
-	When using NAVER ID to become a member: e-mail address, profile picture, NAVER ID, mobile phone number and nick name
-	When using Facebook ID to become a member: e-mail address, open profile information (name, profile picture, age range, sex), and nickname
-	When using LINE to become a member: ID, profile picture, and nickname
-	Items selectively collected for profile : Email address, phone number
Further, contact information stored in users' address book on mobile devices can be collected for the purpose of searching for or inviting the people in the address book. In addition, while using the service or running the app, following information may be collected: IP Address, cookie, time of visit, service use record, error record, device information, and location information. When taking and processing customer inquiry, e-mail address or phone number may be collected

2. Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information
The Company uses personal information to provide service, such as providing contents to use website and/or mobile service, providing customized service, user verification, and searching/notifying/inviting acquaintance.
Further, the Company uses personal information for member management, such as providing service based on membership, identifying member, imposing restriction against user who violated the User Policy, preserving record to resolve dispute, responding to customer inquiry, such as customer complaint, informing user, confirming intent to withdraw as member, etc. Further, personal information may be used in other various marketing/advertisement activities, such as developing new service, providing service and/or posting advertisement based on user’s profile and activities, confirming effectiveness of service, providing information on promotion as well as an opportunity to participate, providing information which may be advertisement in nature, finding access frequency, analyzing statistical information regarding member’s use of service, etc

3. Duration of Preserving and Using Personal Information
As matter of principle, the user’s personal information is promptly destroyed once the purpose for collecting and using personal information is completed. However, pursuant to the Company’s policy which exists to prevent dispute caused by wrongful use of service, the personal information of user who used the service in a wrongful manner, i.e., manner in violation of User Policy or Terms of Use, shall be maintained for one(1) year before destruction. In addition, if the applicable law creates a duty to preserve personal information for a certain period of time, the Company shall keep the personal information for such period.

With the agreement of the terms of use for location information, you may use NAVER's location-based services including Reception of advertisement by using location information.



Article 1. (Purpose)

The purpose of Location Based Service’s Terms and Conditions of Use (Terms and Conditions) is to define the rights and responsibilities and other necessary matters between Naver Corporation (Company) and subject of personal location information (Provider) in regards to the location information business or location based service (LBS) provided by the Company.



Article 2. (Working Rules besides Terms and Conditions)

The matters not specified in this Terms and Conditions shall be in accordance with related laws and regulations such as the Act on the Protection, Use, etc. of Location Information, the Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, etc., Framework Act on Telecommunications, Telecommunications Business Act and with other regulations set by the Company.



Article 3. (Content and Fee of the Service )

① The Company provides the following LBS, after the Company itself collects location information or receives location information from a location information business.

1. Geo Tagging Service: it stores posts written by the subject of personal location information (the Subject) along with the Subject’s location information or that of the mobile device included in the post

2. Providing search results using location information: Upon the request for information search or the provision of the location information of the personal location information Subject or mobile device, it offers search results based on the location information or the information on the adjacent area, such as famous restaurants, nearby businesses and transportation means.

3. Finding or making friends using the location information: Using the current location of the Subject, it finds you friends or suggests friends to you.

4. Exchanging contact information: Using the location information, contact information can be exchanged with friends.

5. Providing advertisements using user’s location: Provides advertisements using the Subject’s current location or the location of the mobile device to the search result or while using other service.

6. User protection and restricting illegal use: Utilizing the location of the Subject of personal location information or mobile device, it blocks abnormal service use attempts made by unauthorized persons.

7. Sharing location information: It shares the location information of the Subject of personal location information or mobile device with the Subject’s acquaintance or a third party designated by the Subject of personal information in order to ensure a safe return of a Subject.

8. Life Convenience including giving directions, etc.: provides optimal routes based on traffic and distances. Other functions may include, but not be limited to, finding nearby facilities, providing information on weather and daily occasions, asking for emergency rescue, etc.

② The fee on LBS specified in Article 1 is free.



Article 4. (Rights of Provider)

① The Provider may defer his/her consent to part of the scope of collecting personal location information and Terms of Use, or part of the objective to use/provide personal location information, the scope of recipient, and LBS.

② The Provider may withdraw all or part of his/her consent to the collection/use/provision of personal location information.

③ The Provider may request temporary suspension on the collection/use/provision of personal location information anytime. In such a case, the Company shall not decline the request, and shall be in possession of technical methods to support such a request.

④ The Provider holds the right to require the Company to access or be notified of below data and in case an error is detected in the below document, the Provider may request for correction. In this case, the Company may not decline such request unless it has a proper reason. 

1. Verification document for confirming use/ provision of location information of the Provide

2. Details and reasons on providing personal location information of the Provider to the third party according to the Act on the Protection, Use, etc. of Location Information as well as other rules and regulations

⑤ In case the Provider withdraws all or part of his/her agreement, the Company shall not hesitate to destroy collected personal location information and verification document on the collection/use/provision of personal location information. However, in case the Provider withdraws only part of his/her agreement, the object for destruction is confined to verification document on personal location information/ location information regarding the section Provider withdraws.

⑥ The Provider may contact the Company using the Company’s contact information stipulated in Article 13 to exercise his/her right set in Clause 1 and 4.



Article 5. (Rights of Legal Representative)

① In case the Company collects, uses or provides personal location information of a child under the age of fourteen (14), it is mandatory to receive agreement from the child him/herself as well as his/her legal representative.

② In case the legal representative agrees on the collection/use/provision of personal location information of minors under the age of fourteen (14), the legal representative may exercise his right to suspend or withdraw agreement as well as temporarily suspend and right to inspect/require for notice. 



Article 6. (Evidence and Duration for Verification Document on use/ provision of location information)

In accordance to the section 2 in Article 16 of Law on Possession and Use of Location Information, the Company automatically records verification document on use/provision of Provider’s location information to location information system and should be in possession such document for more than half year.



Article 7. (Revision and Suspension of the Service)

① In case the Company is not capable of maintaining the service due to legal obstacle or Company’s overall environment such as policy change within location information business or legal proceedings, Company may limit/ modify/suspend all or part of the service.

② In case the service is suspended according to Article 1, the Company must post notification prior to application of the revised provision by posting on internet or notifying to the Provider.



Article 8. (Immediate Notification to Provider Incase Personal Location Information is Provided to the third party)

① The Company must not reveal personal location information without consent from the Provider to the third party. In case such information is to be provided to the third party, the Company should notify of the receiver and purpose of such revelation to the Provider prior to application and obtain consent.

② In case the Company provides personal location information to the third party indicated by the Provider, Company must immediately notify Provider of receiver and date/purpose of receipt every time such provision takes place through appropriate telecommunication device.

③ However in below case, the Company should use telecommunication device or e-mail previously set by the Provider for notification. 

1. If regarding telecommunication device which collected personal location information is not support with text/ voice message or image receiving function.

2. In case the Provider made a prior request to send such information to telecommunication device or email other than the device/e-mail used for collecting Provider’s personal location information.



Article 9. (Rights of the Legal Guardians Responsible for Children Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others)

① In the event the legal guardian of individuals who pertain to the following circumstances (“Child(ren) Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others”) agrees to the use and provision of the individual’s personal information for the purpose of protecting the life or physical wellbeing of Children Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others, it shall be deemed that the Child Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others has also personally agreed to such provision and use. 

1. Child under eight (8) years of age 

2. An individual adjudged incompetent 

3. An individual who has a mental disability, in accordance with provisions in Article 2.2.2 of the Act on Welfare of Persons with Disabilities, and is deemed an individual with a severe handicap, in accordance with Article 2.2 of the Employment Promotion and Vocational Rehabilitation of Disabled Persons Act (limited to individuals who have registered as a disabled individual in accordance with Article 29. Of the Act on Welfare of Persons with Disabilities). 

② The legal guardian who wishes to approve of using and/or providing personal information for the purpose of protecting the life and physical wellbeing of a Child Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others shall attach evidential document that the individual is indeed the legal guardian on a written consent form and submit the documents to the company.

③ In the event the legal guardian approves of the use and provision of a Children Under Eight (8) Years of Age and Others’ Personal location information, the legal guardian will be able to exercise all rights granted to the Subject. 



Article 10. (Compensation for Damages)

In case the Provider experiences damages due to the Company’s violation of article 15 or 26 of Act on the Protection, Use, etc. of Location Information, the Provider may request the violating party to compensate for damage. In this case the Company cannot be exempt from the burden of all costs and responsibility unless the Company can prove itself that such violation was not the result of intention or fault.

This document was originally written in Korean. To the extent the translated English version conflicts with the Korean version, the Korean version controls. 



Article 11. (Settlement of Disputes)

① In regards to a dispute which does not allow agreement or which cannot come to an agreement with the Provider regarding location information, the Company may apply for motions to the National Communications Commission.

② The Company or Subject may submit a request to the Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee for a mediation, in accordance with the Personal Information Protection Act, if parties of a dispute surrounding the provision and/or use of personal information does not, or is unable to reach an agreement.
